title: New: Silence Dogood – Misrepresented
content:
Michigan’s Silence Dogood have that ‘don’t give a fxxk about recording quality’ aesthetic that for some bizarre reason is wholly endearing.

Fuzzy guitars, raw vocals and booming chorus’s form a slightly aggressive Wavves-esque anthem, bursting at the seams with teenage angst and sense of all-too-real despair. Misrepresented is the first track to be taken from Silence Dogood’s forthcoming debut release, check it out below. “When you ate from the Tree of Good and Evil, we all knew we were doomed, and now our eyes are closed, but I can’t seem to fall asleep”
author: 5e9b68b27a1236eccfeb1d27
